snippet: The latest figures, which cover the first three months of 2012, drew criticism of policies but also coincided with a drop in homicides.
abstract: New York City police officers stopped 203,500 people on the streets during the first three months of 2012, drawing criticism of policies but also coinciding with a drop in homicides.
lead_paragraph: The latest figures, which cover the first three months of 2012, drew criticism of policies but also coincided with a drop in homicides.

headline.seo: New York Police Release Data Showing Rise in Number of Stops on Streets
headline.main: New York Police Release Data Showing Rise in Number of Stops on Streets
headline.print_headline: New York Police Release Data Showing Rise in Number of Stops on Streets
